page.title: 17TRANSPORT SERVICES
page.content: Fifty years ago people had to walk to work but today many travel by car.Just over 20 years ago there was a train service from The Lea to either Hereford or Gloucester.Then that line was closed on condition that a comparable bus service was provided. Some rely on a bus service which although subsidised by Councils has had drastic action taken and whose services have been reduced with a continual change of routes resulting in buses running nearly empty,very infrequently and inconveniently e.g a passenger by train from London would arrive in Gloucester at 7.30 p.m.to catch the bus for The Lea but would find that the last bus for The Lea had left Gloucester at 6.30 p.m. An increase in the bus fare is self- defeating for less people use the service which tends to make it shrink.
